title: newBookkeeper
description:
Are you ready to join one of Canada’s most celebrated design firms as a Bookkeeper? Are you analytical, organized and detail-oriented? We’re looking for an enthusiastic individual with related experience to join our inspired team of professionals!

About the Role:

Reporting to the Managing Partners, Creative Matters’ full-time onsite Bookkeeper is responsible for assisting and filing of all payment and financial matters. Responsibilities range from monitoring accounts receivables and payables, forecasting future growth in the organization and abiding by domestic and international financial laws.

About You:

  • Fully Cycle Bookkeeping experience is an asset.
  • Must be comfortable working on a Mac.
  • Knowledge of provincial and territorial sales tax rates, and place of supply rules.
  • Experience with analytics and business growth strategies.
  • Experience completing payroll for an organization and working knowledge of the Employment Standards Act.
  • Ability to complete multi-currency transactions and international wire payments while maintaining accuracy.
  • Excellent analytical and critical thinking abilities, attention to detail and a self-starter who can work with minimum supervision
  • An ability to manage bank and credit card reconciliation.
  • Experience in Job costing and generating reports using QuickBooks online would be an asset Preparing files for accountant at year end.
  • Experience using Ceridian Powerpay or similar programs
  • Experience with AccountEdge, QuickBooks Online and FileMaker, Microsoft Excel or similar programs an asset

What we offer:

  • Competitive compensation package, including health benefits
  • Fast-paced, collaborative and supportive environment
  • Commitment to fair trade practices

Responsibilities:

  • Processing the semi-monthly payroll using Ceridian Powerpay with respect to the Employment Standard Act (ESA).
  • Filling and remitting payments for WSIB, GST/HST, EHT, New York Sales Tax, Advance Corporation tax, and completing transactions while abiding by international sales laws
  • Managing accounts receivable and accounts payable while following up with vendors and clients for payment status.
  • Updating and reconciling customer deposits and vendor deposits while generating timely reports for management and sales team.
  • Keeping track of the inventory on hand, on consignment and shared inventory with other showrooms using spreadsheet and QuickBooks online.
  • An understanding on how to bookkeep for CMI and holding companies connected to the organization.
  • Monthly reconciliation of General ledgers, Credit Card, Bank Accounts, Investments and maintaining the Chart of Accounts to keep the records organized and updated.
  • Generating the cost profit and loss statements for all projects upon completion and submitting it to the partners and respective project managers.
  • Creating quarterly financial reports to forecast future growth of CMI and predict where deficiencies may appear.
  • Posting of journal entries for provision, depreciations, prepaid expenses, accrued interest, inventory adjustments, work in progress to keep the accounting records updated and in line with the accounting principles and CRA’s guidelines.
  • Filling of Records of Employment forms as per the Service Canada guidelines.
  • Prepare, submit and issue annual T4, T4A using Ceridian Powerpay service and keeping proper records as per CRA’s guideline.
  • Performing other ad-hoc duties or assignments as and when requested.

About Creative Matters — creators of inspired wall and floorcoverings:

At Creative Matters we design and create luxurious bespoke floor and wallcoverings. Our custom, fair trade work graces the interiors of such style-setting retailers as Gucci, Tom Ford, Christian Dior and Louis Vuitton as well as luxury hotels and restaurants including The Raleigh, Soho Grand and Rainbow Room (Rockefeller Center). Corporate offices, private homes, and diplomatic residences and embassies worldwide are also home to our creations. We have been privileged to work with some of the world’s most celebrated designers: Yabu Pushelberg, Rem Koolhaas, Robert Stern and William Sofield to name a few. Our fair trade collections are available to consumers through select retailers and designers. Creative Matters proudly supports Label STEP, an international organization committed to promoting environmentally friendly production methods, improving the working and living conditions of carpet weavers, and fighting abusive child labour. www.creativemattersinc.com

  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

title: E-Commerce Coordinator (remote)
description:
We’re looking for an enthusiastic, organized, and proactive individual to take responsibility for the nitty gritty of our ecommerce program. You’ll manage all facets of key ecommerce accounts, working with the sales and marketing teams to execute our growth strategy and turn vision into reality.

It’s a challenging, demanding role that’s not for everyone, but might just be right for you.

Who Are You?

  • You’re an organizational rock star: You can manage and keep track of numerous tasks associated with overlapping projects and multiple accounts.
  • You love little wins: You understand that growth comes from the compound interest of small tasks being executed consistently and on time.
  • Good communicator: You communicate clearly both orally and in writing. This is important for keeping your supervisor and colleagues up to date on your work and for liaising with the accounts.
  • Agile: You can handle the quick pace and adapt to the rapidly changing demands of the ecommerce landscape.
  • Proactive: You will identify issues with product listings or account health and quickly initiate corrective actions.
  • Resourceful: You’ll quickly find answers to customers’ questions and help accelerate their buying decisions.
  • Detail oriented: The devil is in the details, and a typo in a brand name can kill an entire program launch.
  • You’re prepared to eat, breathe, and sleep Amazon.

Required experience

The list of requirements is short.

  • One year of experience with Amazon: Vendor Central and/or Seller Central
  • A passion for customer service
  • Excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage a large number of small administrative tasks

Bonus points

  • Undergraduate degree in business, marketing, economics, communications, or a related field
  • Experience with Amazon advertising
  • Mastery of Excel
  • Experience with SEO and keyword research
  • Familiarity with relevant tools like: Sellics, MerchantWords, Keepa
  • Familiarity with Asana, Ideal Security's project management tool

What does a Ecommerce Coordinator do at Ideal Security?

You’ll be responsible for managing primarily two customers: Amazon and Home Depot. Don’t let that fool you, it’s actually 10 distinct channels to manage:

  • Amazon.com (5): Vendor Central warehouse, direct fulfill, and direct import; Seller Central FBM and FBA
  • Amazon.ca (3): Vendor Central warehouse and direct fulfill; Seller Central FBM
  • Homedepot.com (1): Dropship
  • Homedepot.ca (1): Dropship

What's awesome about this role

  • We have a clear vision to go from Good to Great at ecommerce. You’ll play a key role in making ecommerce management a core competency for the company within five years.
  • You won’t be starting from scratch or doing it alone. We have lots of internal knowledge and experience to lean on, and you’ll be part of a growing team.
  • You’ll have control over your environment: Working with the marketing director, you’ll get to recommend the platforms, tools and freelancers we work with.
  • It’s challenging and complex, with lots of moving parts. There’s lots of experience to gain and lots to learn.
  • You’ll take ownership of projects, clean up messes, and see regular “wins.”
  • You’ll determine how to prioritize your own day-to-day workload based on the strategic direction.
  • You’ll get a 360° view and understanding of the organization’s activities and how your work impacts the success of the company (we don’t work in siloes).

Here is a long but non-exhaustive list of some of the tasks for which you’ll be responsible on any given day:

  • Listing new items: Titles, bullet points, descriptions, images, A+ pages, twisters
  • Submit pricing updates
  • Regular catalogue maintenance, correcting errors (ex: twisters, bullets, titles, brand) and ensuring listings are on brand and optimized
  • Monitoring account health and providing weekly reports to the team about LBB, inventory, late shipments, ROOS
  • Customer support: Responding to questions, monitoring reviews, and implementing any feedback
  • Account maintenance: Disputing suppressions and errors, opening tickets for support and following up
  • Inventory: Monitoring levels and triggering replenishment
  • Marketing: Updating brand store, keyword research for SEO, running ads, reporting on metrics

Who are we?

Ideal Security is a third-generation family business with a 65-year history and an eye on the future. Our team today consists of 10 in the office (hybrid work model) plus 4 in our warehouse (in Ontario). Most of the team has been with the company more than 15 years. We’re laying the groundwork for the future in a rapidly evolving environment. Our primary targets for growth right now are diversification into new product markets and building out core competencies in marketing and sales with a focus on digital.

  • Our industry: Import and distribution
  • Our product category: Specialty hardware (door and window locks; ladder accessories, storage)
  • Our customers: Retailers (omnichannel), manufacturers, industrial, and individuals.
  • Our market: North America

We offer benefits like group health, life, and disability insurance and RRSP contribution matching, and a family-oriented culture. We don’t work evenings or weekends. We don’t have rushed deadlines. We go home at night and sleep easy.

We expect all our people to actively live and demonstrate our core values of Team, Collaboration, Ownership, and being Dynamic.

How to apply

If this sounds exciting to you, make sure to provide a cover letter that begins with the specific statement “I’m an organizational rock star and obsessive about getting things done,” explains where you’ve had experience working with Amazon, and highlights anything that gets you bonus points [see above].

Send your application, including cover letter and CV, to:

Liohn Sherer
Executive VP

Salary: $40,000.00-$58,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Mask wearing in office, hand sanitizer in every office. Regular cleaning of carpet and floors

Expected start date: 2022-05-23

title: Houseperson (Part Time) (150847)
description:
Create moments of joy that truly matter.

Exuding sleek sophistication and full of Zen-like energy, Shangri-La Vancouver is your urban sanctuary nestled between the mountains and the sea and located within the core of a vibrant metropolis. Occupying 15 floors of the tallest building in Vancouver, the hotel sits at the heart of the city’s most popular downtown areas. With a lustrous balance of tranquil surroundings coupled with inspirational design, Shangri-La Vancouver hosts people to the colourful joys of life. Shangri-La Vancouver has been awarded the Forbes Five-Star designation and the AAA Five Diamond honour; one of only four hotels in Canada to hold both acclaimed ratings.

Inspired by our Asian heritage, we obsess over the guest experience and seek to deliver hospitality from the heart. Our Colleagues are our unique strength. We seek to hire and develop charismatic, dedicated, and passionate individuals to make their dream career, a reality.

Join our world-class team as we pioneer new horizons.

Your Shangri-La awaits!

We are currently searching for a superstar Houseperson to join our Housekeeping Team. This is a part time position with the potential of working up to 40 hours per week. Our ideal candidate would have an eye for detail and a personal standard of perfection, in providing a high cleaning standard that extends well beyond the fifth star. Our team of hardworking room attendants take great pride in ensuring our product shines, and exceeds our guests expectations of cleanliness and comfort. The ideal candidate would bring previous experience in the industry from another world class Hotel or resort, and fully understands quality standards of both room cleanliness and service excellence. Our award winning team of consummate hospitality professionals take pride in their work and warmly and genuinely engage our guests and fellow colleagues, keeping our workplace productive, professional and fun!

Are you ready for your next challenge? Are you ready to be part of the best in the city? Are you Shangri-La?

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Communicate with internal colleagues to advise and attend all the guest(s) service needs, items which require maintenance, issues or concerns in a prompt, proactive manner as appropriate
Clean and maintain public restrooms, public areas, back-of-house, and other assigned work areas within hotel and its surroundings using approved hotel products and equipment, to hotel housekeeping standards
Assist in the receiving of Housekeeping stock and prepare and maintain Housekeeping storage areas to Shangri-La standards of cleanliness and safety.
Provide waste removal and janitorial duties specific to special cleaning projects, as assigned.
Removes trash collected by room attendants from service areas.
Deliver towels, toiletries, cribs, roll-away beds and other requested items to the guest rooms.
Pickup clean linens and refill the par stock of linen on each floor pantry, as required.
Cleans rugs, carpets and upholstered furniture using a vacuum cleaner, broom and shampoo machine.
Assist in the cleaning of guest rooms, including changing of sheets and removal of garbage
Sanitizes high touch point areas of the hotel including public areas, spa, health club and back of house, as required
Collects soiled linen for laundering, assisting in the hotel laundry, as required.
Assist other Housekeeping Colleagues with the preparation of guest rooms, as assigned
Assist room attendants with moving heavy furniture items, as required
Complete deep cleaning tasks, as assigned such as sweeping, mopping floors and washing windows
Clean all public areas as required following department standard operating procedures.
Report missing / found articles, damage or merchandise problems to the housekeeping supervisors.
Report all defects and damage to Housekeeping Management to ensure it is logged and actioned
Undertake other ad hoc related responsibilities, as required.

The following is considered mandatory for this position:
Service Excellence – Delight our guests at every interaction with a genuinely warm presence, friendly, sincere nature, drive for service excellence, internally proud, outwardly gracious and humble
Detail oriented –Great care and attention to detail in a fast paced environment
Cleanliness Orientation – Demonstrated need for order and cleanliness, well-groomed with good personal hygiene
Functional Competence – Safely work with cleaning chemicals, lift up to 50 lbs, stand, reach, grip and exert steady-paced mobility, able to push and pull carts or equipment weighing up to 250 lbs regularly throughout 8 hour shift
Operational Knowledge –Learn and follow SLa deliverables, SLV and Housekeeping service standards, programs, policies and procedures
Self motivation – Able to follow through on direction, with minimal supervision
Communication – Able to comprehend, read, write and speak English including workplace policies, job instruction, departmental and safety information
Problem solving –Able to prioritize, multi-task, help others; calmly, respectfully, creatively and successfully resolve problems, as required
Emotional maturity – Interacts with others in a respectful manner, with demonstrated qualities of sincerity, helpfulness, courtesy and humility
Ethical and professional conduct – Fulfills responsibilities with highest integrity
Technology proficiency– Fully competent in all systems used within department

SHANGRI-LA VANCOUVER COLLEAGUE PRIVILEGES

…we enable people to live, work, play, eat, and rest well through the environments we create and the memorable experiences we deliver! Our Colleagues have access to the following:

Adventure to 100+ Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts with Colleague Travel perks
Experience our renowned food & beverage with a special Colleague Discount
Pamper yourself with discounted wellness journeys and luxury products from CHI the Spa
Enjoy exclusive access to discounted theatre, cinema, and retailers through our partner programs!
Indulge in specialty pricing on luxurious pillowtop beds and linens through our partner programs.
Connect your event leads or employee referrals to earn special rewards.
Celebrate with your fellow Colleagues in team recognition events throughout the year.
Pursue your own ongoing development through courses and learning workshops as part of the Shangri-La Academy

ABOUT SHANGRI-LA HOTELS AND RESORTS

Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts has been established in luxury since 1971, with locations in North America, Asia, the Middle East, Europe, Oceania, and Africa.
Sister brands include Traders Hotels, Kerry Hotels, and JEN Hotels. Further, the Shangri-La Group holds a diverse portfolio of commercial properties, residences, services, and clubs.
CHI, The Spa at Shangri-La, draws inspiration from the origins of the Shangri-La legend, which describes a unique place of personal peace, enchantment, and well-being. This is a luxurious sanctuary where holistic treatments based on time-honoured methods shared by many Asian cultures bring total relaxation and a feeling of well-being.

Shangri-La Vancouver is committed to fostering a workplace that both promotes and places sincere value on diversity and inclusion. We are committed to maintaining a rich tapestry of talent from across race, gender, age, religion, identity, and life experience.

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply at http://www.areyoushangri-la.com. Due to the volume of applicants, we will only contact those candidates we wish to pursue further.

Shangri-La Vancouver will only consider candidates who currently possess the legal right to work in Canada. Applicants must be Canadian Citizens, Permanent Residents, or be in active possession of an Open Work Permit and valid Social Insurance Number. Shangri-La Vancouver is unable assist international applicants in obtaining the legal right to work.

We thank all applicants for their time and interest in Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts.

Shangri-La Hotel Vancouver invites you to view our property promotional video at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1egGt63vMCg

CHI the Spa invites you to view our promotional video at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4RlEOOFweXM

Elte is Toronto's source for considered design for all things home. For over 100 years, our family has worked with designers and craftspeople from idea to object, curating timeless pieces and the most distinct creations. Our sister brand, Mkt, is an independent design house creating pieces for a modern, edited home. We have three large showrooms within Toronto's Design District. In the Elte Showroom, you'll find Rugs and Carpeting, Furniture, Lighting, Mattresses, Linens and Home Decor.


Who you are:

You are a builder and entrepreneur who is savvy with numbers and have a strong retail acumen. You are passionate about product, obsessed with exceptional service, and deeply committed to bringing the best of design and taste to our customer. Under the leadership and guidance of the Director of Merchandising, you will work with Planners and Inventory Analysts as well as Product Leadership to shape the growth, financial success and strategy for your designated product category.


What You Do (among other things):

  • Work with cross-functional partners (Marketing, Digital, Store Sales, Product Development) for organization, presentation and approval of a go-to-market strategy and resulting product launch calendar
  • Create seasonal assortment buy sheets
  • Identify and input all product attribution and hierarchy designations
  • Organize price change recommendations and associated price change files
  • Develop and maintain a product knowledge resource library
  • Assist with training for new product launches and refreshers on existing product assortment
  • Attend cross-functional team huddles and department team meetings as a representative of the product category; keep and share diligent notes on deliverables and key takeaways from said sessions
  • Problem-solve issues and strategize solutions in coordination with other departments, including Purchasing, Sales, Marketing, Digital Visual Merchandising
  • Partner with vendors to roll out packaging standards and maintain library of packaging files
  • Assist in the building of the product category’s core strategy, including SKU optimization, stock and replenishment approaches, vendor negotiations, competitive analysis, pricing ladders, etc.
  • Own a subset of the product category, under the guidance and leadership of the Director of Merchandising, to hone leadership skills and begin building autonomy through accountability for the success of decisions made
  • Be a steward for and advocate of the company’s Values
  • Embody service and serve as a positive representative the brand within the organization and outside of the company

Requirements Desired Attributes:

  • 5 to 8 Years of applicable experience
  • Strong Excel skills
  • Experience in luxury and big-ticker retail environment strongly preferred
  • Passionate about product, design, and architecture
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and self-starter mentality
  • Strategic thinker with excellent attention to detail and ability to effectively communicate, inspire and achieve results
  • Curious, driven, and takes initiative

description:
We’re hiring! Mastermind Toys - the Most Innovative Retailer of 2020 and Canada’s Authority on Play and we want YOU to join our growing team! We have a customer-obsessed culture, which we believe starts with employee experience. You’ll join an innovative, agile team of kids-at-heart—passionate about sparking wonder and new discoveries with everything we do. We jump at the chance to co-create with our customers and employees, while staying true to our Canadian roots. Over 36 years later, Mastermind Toys is the nation’s largest specialty toy and children’s bookstore, and we deeply believe that “Play is Kids’ Work.
We are currently seeking a Permanent Part-time Shift Leaderto join our Clarkson Crossing location. Our shift leaders bring fun, learning and confidence to parents & children by providing an exceptional customer experience and contributing to the profitability, success and growth of the store. They oversee store operations, including shift task organization and store opening and closing duties, in conjunction with/or in the absence of management.
This is a great growth opportunity for someone looking to expand their leadership skills in a part time role. We are seeking individuals with flexible availability including days, evenings, weekends and holidays.
Job and Responsibilities will include:
Sales Assistance and Processing

  • Greet, actively approach & assist customers consistent with the Mastermind customer experience philosophy; ensure customers are always the primary focus over tasks
  • Seek to understand customer needs, communicate relevant product information; be able to explain/demonstrate product use (demonstrate sound product knowledge across all product categories), age target, special features, options etc. & in-store promotions; make suggestions for additional product to enhance purchase. Inform customers of services and specials. Consistently deliver a shopping experience that is BETTER than expected
  • Receive & process payments, returns, exchanges accurately & in accordance with POS procedures and customer service and sales philosophy
  • Gift wrap purchase to standard
  • Actively contribute to achieve team and store goals

Store Operations

  • Participate to maintain best practice merchandising standards throughout the shift; create inviting, attractive displays; keep store shelves fully stocked and neat; assemble product as required
  • Participate in safeguarding staff, customers & product through pro-active assistance; comply with loss prevention and health and safety & emergency procedures
  • May be asked to participate in the health & safety committee and/or first aider programs. Ensure personal conduct is consistent with safety and security policies
  • Process inventory in and out of store in accordance with standardized procedures. May participate in inventory counts
  • Participate in general store upkeep including dusting, floor, carpet, window, kitchen and bathroom cleaning. Participate (as applicable) in external walkway maintenance
  • May participate in monitoring store supply levels
  • Complete other duties as may be assigned from time to time

Follow security systems and protocols. Participate and advocate the safeguarding of staff, customers & product through the management of pro-active assistance; zone management; compliance with loss prevention and health and safety; store maintenance & emergency procedures
Qualifications:

  • High school diploma preferred.
  • Previous retail sales and POS experience required
  • Previous experience in as a key holder or shift leader is preferred. Able to organize and get work done through others
  • Strong planning and accuracy skills
  • Demonstrated ability & interest to provide exceptional quality customer focused sales assistance
  • Able to project an enthusiastic, polite and welcoming demeanour. Strong & clear verbal and written communication skills

Mastermind Toys is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. Upon request, Mastermind Toys will, in consultation with the applicant, determine the nature of any accommodation that may be required.

title: HOUSEPERSON
description:
Create moments of joy that truly matter.

Exuding sleek sophistication and full of Zen-like energy, Shangri-La Vancouver is your urban sanctuary nestled between the mountains and the sea and located within the core of a vibrant metropolis. Occupying 15 floors of the tallest building in Vancouver, the hotel sits at the heart of the city’s most popular downtown areas. With a lustrous balance of tranquil surroundings coupled with inspirational design, Shangri-La Vancouver hosts people to the colourful joys of life. Shangri-La Vancouver has been awarded the Forbes Five-Star designation and the AAA Five Diamond honour; one of only four hotels in Canada to hold both acclaimed ratings.

Inspired by our Asian heritage, we obsess over the guest experience and seek to deliver hospitality from the heart. Our Colleagues are our unique strength. We seek to hire and develop charismatic, dedicated, and passionate individuals to make their dream career, a reality.

Join our world-class team as we pioneer new horizons.

Your Shangri-La awaits!

We are currently searching for a superstar Houseperson to join our Housekeeping Team. This is a Part Time position, earning a full wage of $26.50 per hour (following the completion of an initial 3 month probationary period).

Our ideal candidate would have an eye for detail and a personal standard of perfection, in providing a high cleaning standard that enhances our luxury guest experience. Areas of responsibility include public areas, back of house spaces, general housekeeping inventory and supporting our room attendants in preparing guest rooms. Our hardworking housekeeping professionals take great pride in ensuring our product shines, and exceed our guests expectations of cleanliness and comfort. The ideal candidate would bring previous experience in the industry from another hotel or resort, and fully understands quality standards of public area cleanliness and service excellence. Our award winning team of consummate hospitality professionals take pride in their work and warmly and genuinely engage our guests and fellow colleagues, keeping our workplace productive, professional and fun!

JOB REQUIREMENTS

With personal commitment and an emotional sense of gracious hospitality, make the most positive impact on guest experiences throughout all aspects of their stay by ensuring overall cleanliness, detail and care of hotel areas and guest rooms, maximizing the balance between Colleague, Guest and Owner satisfaction. Job responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Communicate with internal colleagues to advise and attend all the guest(s) service needs, items which require maintenance, issues or concerns in a prompt, proactive manner as appropriate
  • Clean and maintain public restrooms, public areas, back-of-house, and other assigned work areas within hotel and its surroundings using approved hotel products and equipment, to hotel housekeeping standard
  • Assist in the receiving of Housekeeping stock and prepare and maintain Housekeeping storage areas to Shangri-La standards of cleanliness and safety
  • Provide waste removal and janitorial duties specific to special cleaning projects, as assigned.
  • Removes trash collected by room attendants from service areas.
  • Deliver towels, toiletries, cribs, roll-away beds and other requested items to the guest rooms.
  • Pickup clean linens and refill the par stock of linen on each floor pantry, as required.
  • Cleans rugs, carpets and upholstered furniture using a vacuum cleaner, broom and shampoo machine.
  • Assist in the cleaning of guest rooms, including changing of sheets and removal of garbage
  • Collects soiled linen for laundering.
  • Assist in laundry area of hotel, as required.
  • Assist other Housekeeping Colleagues with the preparation of guest rooms, as assigned
  • Assist room attendants with moving heavy furniture items, as required
  • Complete deep cleaning tasks, as assigned such as sweeping, mopping floors and washing windows
  • Clean all public areas as required following department standard operating procedures.
  • Report missing / found articles, damage or merchandise problems to the housekeeping supervisors.
  • Report all defects and damage to Housekeeping Management to ensure it is logged and actioned
  • Undertake other ad hoc related responsibilities, as required.
Job Requirements/Qualifications:

The following is expected for this position:

  • Position is physical in nature and requires regular lifting, bending, reaching, stretching, squatting
  • Minimum 2 years previous work experience in a similar capacity is preferred
  • Demonstrated understanding of luxury hotel standards of service
  • Candidates must have unrestricted availability

SHANGRI-LA VANCOUVER COLLEAGUE PRIVILEGES

…we enable people to live, work, play, eat, and rest well through the environments we create and the memorable experiences we deliver! Our Colleagues have access to the following:

  • Adventure to 100+ Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts with Colleague Travel perks
  • Experience our renowned food & beverage with a special Colleague Discount
  • Pamper yourself with discounted wellness journeys and luxury products from CHI the Spa
  • Enjoy exclusive access to discounted theatre, cinema, and retailers through our partner programs!
  • Indulge in specialty pricing on luxurious pillowtop beds and linens through our partner programs.
  • Connect your event leads or employee referrals to earn special rewards.
  • Celebrate with your fellow Colleagues in team recognition events throughout the year.
  • Pursue your ongoing development through courses and learning workshops as part of the Shangri-La Academy
  • Pursue your own ongoing development through our education reimbursement program

ABOUT SHANGRI-LA HOTELS AND RESORTS

  • Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts has been established in luxury since 1971, with locations in North America, Asia, the Middle East, Europe, Oceania, and Africa.
  • Sister brands include Traders Hotels, Kerry Hotels, and JEN Hotels. Further, the Shangri-La Group holds a diverse portfolio of commercial properties, residences, services, and clubs.
  • CHI, The Spa at Shangri-La, draws inspiration from the origins of the Shangri-La legend, which describes a unique place of personal peace, enchantment, and well-being. This is a luxurious sanctuary where holistic treatments based on time-honoured methods shared by many Asian cultures bring total relaxation and a feeling of well-being.

Shangri-La Vancouver is committed to fostering a workplace that both promotes and places sincere value on diversity and inclusion. We are committed to maintaining a rich tapestry of talent from across race, gender, age, religion, identity, and life experience.

  • Salary/Wage: $26.50 + Shangri-La Colleague Perks

Interested candidates are encouraged to click the below link or visit our career portal at http://www.areyoushangri-la.com to apply directly for our positions. Due to the volume of applicants, we will only contact those candidates we wish to pursue further.

Shangri-La Vancouver will only consider candidates who currently possess the legal right to work in Canada. Applicants must be Canadian Citizens, Permanent Residents, or be in active possession of an Open Work Permit and valid Social Insurance Number. Shangri-La Vancouver is unable assist international applicants in obtaining the legal right to work.

We thank all applicants for their time and interest in Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts.

title: Assistant Property Manager
description:
Location

Brookfield Place Calgary - 225 6th Avenue SW, Suite 1220

Business

Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations — bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. It’s why the world’s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.

If you’re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.

Job Description

DESCRIPTION:
A managerial position which is responsible to support and assist the Property Manager to ensure the successful day to day operations of the property. The position requires an individual which exemplifies professionalism, service excellence, attention to detail and focus on quality. The role is a Brookfield Ambassador specializing in relationship management with high profile tenants within Brookfield Place Calgary. The position is the conduit and liaison for tenants in which, through constant communication and follow up with other departments ensuring a timely resolution to operational issues while minimizing tenant impact. Supervising and providing direction to the Tenant Services team to ensure the appearance of the exterior and interior common areas of the complex are always maintained to the highest standard. Working closely with the Property Manager to ensure tenant satisfaction, budgets and capital plans are prepared and managed as per objectives; negotiate, award and monitor building contracts in accordance with polices; preparation of property and monthly financial reports within the required timelines; liaise with tenants, contractors, and employees. The incumbent will assist the property manager to oversee the operational and administrative functions associated with the property, ensuring the asset is managed and operated at the highest possible standard in accordance with Brookfield’s goals, objectives and all applicable codes, environmental requirements, and government legislation.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Primary tenant contact for escalated inquiries and requests, requiring detailed coordination and communication between the tenants, operations, security, construction, accounting and building services ensuring all requests and concerns are dealt with in a professional manner to ensure tenant satisfaction.
Managing the day-to-day operations of the Tenant Services Department comprised of one Tenant Services Coordinator, one Building Services Supervisor, two Building Services Technicians and one Receptionist/Administrative assistant. Monitoring and providing daily support, participating in performance management, setting objectives, and providing development through training and education.
Take personal responsibility to promote and adhere to all safety, health, and environment policies. Lead by example to proactively identify, report, manage and mitigate potential hazards and follow through to resolution.
Liaising with base building contractors on projects ensuring they are completed as scheduled and in accordance with the budget guidelines including window cleaning, landscaping, waste removal, carpet cleaning, pest control, janitorial, parking, and common area repairs.
Assist in Supervising the $1.8 million Janitorial contract to ensure the contractor maintains compliance with the agreement, monthly costs are within the established budget and the service provided meets the tenants and Brookfield’s expectations. Conduct monthly meetings and inspections as required.
Attend Monthly Parking contract meetings and assist with parking recommendations to improve the parking experience, maximize revenue, and ensure parker satisfaction. Review monthly parking reports and ensure the data is cross referenced with Tenant lease information.
Conduct monthly “Key Account Meetings” with the large office tenants documenting discussions of their issues for distribution to all departments. Meet with other tenants including retailers on a regular basis and ensure all meetings are tracked and minutes are taken.
Coordinating all tenant move-in/move-out(s) in conjunction with construction, operations, security and building service/loading dock ensuring all procedures are followed. Ensuring signage, access cards, mailboxes, recycling, Life Safety manual and Tenant Information Guides are appropriately distributed. Conduct New Tenant Orientation meetings to ensure tenants are educated on the building regulations, procedures, and contacts.
Routinely review to ensure the Tenant Information Guide, Tenant Database and web site information is accurate and continuously update to date. Additionally, working with the Marketing team to ensure the Brookfield App updates accurate and timely.
Oversee the Tenant Services Coordinator and Financial Services Group, in monitoring that the Accounts Receivable process and ensure all outstanding balances are followed on a timely basis ensuring the A/R is always current.
Administration of all lease documentation, storage area management and leases ensuring the information is kept updated and accurate at all times.
Assisting the Property Manager to generate and compile the monthly financial report. Assist and provide support to the managers regarding variance comments and other requirements included in the monthly reports.
Assisting the Property Manager with budget preparation, contract negotiation and management of operating costs by adhering to purchasing processes, reviewing and approval of all billings, maintaining accurate maintenance and administrative records. Assist and provide support to the managers to ensure accurate and timely entry into YARDI relating to day-to-day expenses and one time projects.
Other duties as assigned.

SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS:
A proven leader, who exhibits and insists on a standard of excellence, and shares our vision to work collaboratively with others to meet our commitment to providing outstanding customer service. The ideal candidate works independently and has the proven ability to deal with difficult/sensitive situations. In addition, the successful candidate will have strong communication and organizational skills with the ability to multitask.

EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS:
Minimum 5 years working experience in a large commercial building environment.
Minimum 5 years management experience.
Minimum 5 years of experience with direct supervision of staff

EDUCATION / DESIGNATIONS / LICENSES:

title: E-Commerce Coordinator (remote)
description:
We’re looking for an enthusiastic, organized, and proactive individual to take responsibility for the nitty gritty of our ecommerce program. You’ll manage all facets of key ecommerce accounts, working with the sales and marketing teams to execute our growth strategy and turn vision into reality.

It’s a challenging, demanding role that’s not for everyone, but might just be right for you.

Who Are You?

  • You’re an organizational rock star: You can manage and keep track of numerous tasks associated with overlapping projects and multiple accounts.
  • You love little wins: You understand that growth comes from the compound interest of small tasks being executed consistently and on time.
  • Good communicator: You communicate clearly both orally and in writing. This is important for keeping your supervisor and colleagues up to date on your work and for liaising with the accounts.
  • Agile: You can handle the quick pace and adapt to the rapidly changing demands of the ecommerce landscape.
  • Proactive: You will identify issues with product listings or account health and quickly initiate corrective actions.
  • Resourceful: You’ll quickly find answers to customers’ questions and help accelerate their buying decisions.
  • Detail oriented: The devil is in the details, and a typo in a brand name can kill an entire program launch.
  • You’re prepared to eat, breathe, and sleep Amazon.

Required experience

The list of requirements is short.

  • One year of experience with Amazon: Vendor Central and/or Seller Central
  • A passion for customer service
  • Excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage a large number of small administrative tasks

Bonus points

  • Undergraduate degree in business, marketing, economics, communications, or a related field
  • Experience with Amazon advertising
  • Mastery of Excel
  • Experience with SEO and keyword research
  • Familiarity with relevant tools like: Sellics, MerchantWords, Keepa
  • Familiarity with Asana, Ideal Security's project management tool

What does a Ecommerce Coordinator do at Ideal Security?

You’ll be responsible for managing primarily two customers: Amazon and Home Depot. Don’t let that fool you, it’s actually 10 distinct channels to manage:

  • Amazon.com (5): Vendor Central warehouse, direct fulfill, and direct import; Seller Central FBM and FBA
  • Amazon.ca (3): Vendor Central warehouse and direct fulfill; Seller Central FBM
  • Homedepot.com (1): Dropship
  • Homedepot.ca (1): Dropship

What's awesome about this role

  • We have a clear vision to go from Good to Great at ecommerce. You’ll play a key role in making ecommerce management a core competency for the company within five years.
  • You won’t be starting from scratch or doing it alone. We have lots of internal knowledge and experience to lean on, and you’ll be part of a growing team.
  • You’ll have control over your environment: Working with the marketing director, you’ll get to recommend the platforms, tools and freelancers we work with.
  • It’s challenging and complex, with lots of moving parts. There’s lots of experience to gain and lots to learn.
  • You’ll take ownership of projects, clean up messes, and see regular “wins.”
  • You’ll determine how to prioritize your own day-to-day workload based on the strategic direction.
  • You’ll get a 360° view and understanding of the organization’s activities and how your work impacts the success of the company (we don’t work in siloes).

Here is a long but non-exhaustive list of some of the tasks for which you’ll be responsible on any given day:

  • Listing new items: Titles, bullet points, descriptions, images, A+ pages, twisters
  • Submit pricing updates
  • Regular catalogue maintenance, correcting errors (ex: twisters, bullets, titles, brand) and ensuring listings are on brand and optimized
  • Monitoring account health and providing weekly reports to the team about LBB, inventory, late shipments, ROOS
  • Customer support: Responding to questions, monitoring reviews, and implementing any feedback
  • Account maintenance: Disputing suppressions and errors, opening tickets for support and following up
  • Inventory: Monitoring levels and triggering replenishment
  • Marketing: Updating brand store, keyword research for SEO, running ads, reporting on metrics

Who are we?

Ideal Security is a third-generation family business with a 65-year history and an eye on the future. Our team today consists of 10 in the office (hybrid work model) plus 4 in our warehouse (in Ontario). Most of the team has been with the company more than 15 years. We’re laying the groundwork for the future in a rapidly evolving environment. Our primary targets for growth right now are diversification into new product markets and building out core competencies in marketing and sales with a focus on digital.

  • Our industry: Import and distribution
  • Our product category: Specialty hardware (door and window locks; ladder accessories, storage)
  • Our customers: Retailers (omnichannel), manufacturers, industrial, and individuals.
  • Our market: North America

We offer benefits like group health, life, and disability insurance and RRSP contribution matching, and a family-oriented culture. We don’t work evenings or weekends. We don’t have rushed deadlines. We go home at night and sleep easy.

We expect all our people to actively live and demonstrate our core values of Team, Collaboration, Ownership, and being Dynamic.

How to apply

If this sounds exciting to you, make sure to provide a cover letter that begins with the specific statement “I’m an organizational rock star and obsessive about getting things done,” explains where you’ve had experience working with Amazon, and highlights anything that gets you bonus points [see above].

Send your application, including cover letter and CV, to:

Liohn Sherer
Executive VP

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00-$58,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Mask wearing in office, hand sanitizer in every office. Regular cleaning of carpet and floors

Expected start date: 2022-05-23

title: Bookkeeper
description:
Are you ready to join one of Canada’s most celebrated design firms as a Bookkeeper? Are you analytical, organized and detail-oriented? We’re looking for an enthusiastic individual with related experience to join our inspired team of professionals!

About the Role:

Reporting to the Managing Partners, Creative Matters’ full-time onsite Bookkeeper is responsible for assisting and filing of all payment and financial matters. Responsibilities range from monitoring accounts receivables and payables, forecasting future growth in the organization and abiding by domestic and international financial laws.

About You:

  • Fully Cycle Bookkeeping experience is an asset.
  • Must be comfortable working on a Mac.
  • Knowledge of provincial and territorial sales tax rates, and place of supply rules.
  • Experience with analytics and business growth strategies.
  • Experience completing payroll for an organization and working knowledge of the Employment Standards Act.
  • Ability to complete multi-currency transactions and international wire payments while maintaining accuracy.
  • Excellent analytical and critical thinking abilities, attention to detail and a self-starter who can work with minimum supervision
  • An ability to manage bank and credit card reconciliation.
  • Experience in Job costing and generating reports using QuickBooks online would be an asset Preparing files for accountant at year end.
  • Experience using Ceridian Powerpay or similar programs
  • Experience with AccountEdge, QuickBooks Online and FileMaker, Microsoft Excel or similar programs an asset

What we offer:

  • Competitive compensation package, including health benefits
  • Fast-paced, collaborative and supportive environment
  • Commitment to fair trade practices

Responsibilities:

  • Processing the semi-monthly payroll using Ceridian Powerpay with respect to the Employment Standard Act (ESA).
  • Filling and remitting payments for WSIB, GST/HST, EHT, New York Sales Tax, Advance Corporation tax, and completing transactions while abiding by international sales laws
  • Managing accounts receivable and accounts payable while following up with vendors and clients for payment status.
  • Updating and reconciling customer deposits and vendor deposits while generating timely reports for management and sales team.
  • Keeping track of the inventory on hand, on consignment and shared inventory with other showrooms using spreadsheet and QuickBooks online.
  • An understanding on how to bookkeep for CMI and holding companies connected to the organization.
  • Monthly reconciliation of General ledgers, Credit Card, Bank Accounts, Investments and maintaining the Chart of Accounts to keep the records organized and updated.
  • Generating the cost profit and loss statements for all projects upon completion and submitting it to the partners and respective project managers.
  • Creating quarterly financial reports to forecast future growth of CMI and predict where deficiencies may appear.
  • Posting of journal entries for provision, depreciations, prepaid expenses, accrued interest, inventory adjustments, work in progress to keep the accounting records updated and in line with the accounting principles and CRA’s guidelines.
  • Filling of Records of Employment forms as per the Service Canada guidelines.
  • Prepare, submit and issue annual T4, T4A using Ceridian Powerpay service and keeping proper records as per CRA’s guideline.
  • Performing other ad-hoc duties or assignments as and when requested.

About Creative Matters — creators of inspired wall and floorcoverings:

At Creative Matters we design and create luxurious bespoke floor and wallcoverings. Our custom, fair trade work graces the interiors of such style-setting retailers as Gucci, Tom Ford, Christian Dior and Louis Vuitton as well as luxury hotels and restaurants including The Raleigh, Soho Grand and Rainbow Room (Rockefeller Center). Corporate offices, private homes, and diplomatic residences and embassies worldwide are also home to our creations. We have been privileged to work with some of the world’s most celebrated designers: Yabu Pushelberg, Rem Koolhaas, Robert Stern and William Sofield to name a few. Our fair trade collections are available to consumers through select retailers and designers. Creative Matters proudly supports Label STEP, an international organization committed to promoting environmentally friendly production methods, improving the working and living conditions of carpet weavers, and fighting abusive child labour. www.creativemattersinc.com

Join our world-class team as we pioneer new horizons.

Our team of hardworking room attendants take great pride in ensuring our product shines, and exceeds our guests expectations of cleanliness and comfort. The ideal candidate would bring previous experience in the industry from another world class Hotel or resort, and fully understands quality standards of both room cleanliness and service excellence. Our award winning team of consummate hospitality professionals take pride in their work and warmly and genuinely engage our guests and fellow colleagues, keeping our workplace productive, professional and fun!

Are you ready for your next challenge? Are you ready to be part of the best in the city? Are you Shangri-La?

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Communicate with internal colleagues to advise and attend all the guest(s) service needs, items which require maintenance, issues or concerns in a prompt, proactive manner as appropriate
Clean and maintain public restrooms, public areas, back-of-house, and other assigned work areas within hotel and its surroundings using approved hotel products and equipment, to hotel housekeeping standards
Assist in the receiving of Housekeeping stock and prepare and maintain Housekeeping storage areas to Shangri-La standards of cleanliness and safety.
Provide waste removal and janitorial duties specific to special cleaning projects, as assigned.
Removes trash collected by room attendants from service areas.
Deliver towels, toiletries, cribs, roll-away beds and other requested items to the guest rooms.
Pickup clean linens and refill the par stock of linen on each floor pantry, as required.
Cleans rugs, carpets and upholstered furniture using a vacuum cleaner, broom and shampoo machine.
Assist in the cleaning of guest rooms, including changing of sheets and removal of garbage

Collects soiled linen for laundering, assisting in the hotel laundry, as required.
Assist other Housekeeping Colleagues with the preparation of guest rooms, as assigned
Assist room attendants with moving heavy furniture items, as required

Clean all public areas as required following department standard operating procedures.

Report all defects and damage to Housekeeping Management to ensure it is logged and actioned
Undertake other ad hoc related responsibilities, as required.

title: Assistant Merchant Luxury Retailer
description:
Assistant Merchant


Who We Are:

Elte is Toronto's source for considered design for all things home. For over 100 years, our family has worked with designers and craftspeople from idea to object, curating timeless pieces and the most distinct creations. Our sister brand, Mkt, is an independent design house creating pieces for a modern, edited home. We have three large showrooms within Toronto's Design District. In the Elte Showroom, you'll find Rugs and Carpeting, Furniture, Lighting, Mattresses, Linens and Home Decor.


Who you are:

You are a builder and entrepreneur who is savvy with numbers and have a strong retail acumen. You are passionate about product, obsessed with exceptional service, and deeply committed to bringing the best of design and taste to our customer. Under the leadership and guidance of the Director of Merchandising, you will work with Planners and Inventory Analysts as well as Product Leadership to shape the growth, financial success and strategy for your designated product category.


What You Do (among other things):

  • Work with cross-functional partners (Marketing, Digital, Store Sales, Product Development) for organization, presentation and approval of a go-to-market strategy and resulting product launch calendar
  • Create seasonal assortment buy sheets
  • Identify and input all product attribution and hierarchy designations
  • Organize price change recommendations and associated price change files
  • Develop and maintain a product knowledge resource library
  • Assist with training for new product launches and refreshers on existing product assortment
  • Attend cross-functional team huddles and department team meetings as a representative of the product category; keep and share diligent notes on deliverables and key takeaways from said sessions
  • Problem-solve issues and strategize solutions in coordination with other departments, including Purchasing, Sales, Marketing, Digital Visual Merchandising
  • Partner with vendors to roll out packaging standards and maintain library of packaging files
  • Assist in the building of the product category’s core strategy, including SKU optimization, stock and replenishment approaches, vendor negotiations, competitive analysis, pricing ladders, etc.
  • Own a subset of the product category, under the guidance and leadership of the Director of Merchandising, to hone leadership skills and begin building autonomy through accountability for the success of decisions made
  • Be a steward for and advocate of the company’s Values
  • Embody service and serve as a positive representative the brand within the organization and outside of the company

Requirements Desired Attributes:

  • 5 to 8 Years of applicable experience
  • Strong Excel skills
  • Experience in luxury and big-ticker retail environment strongly preferred
  • Passionate about product, design, and architecture
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and self-starter mentality
  • Strategic thinker with excellent attention to detail and ability to effectively communicate, inspire and achieve results
  • Curious, driven, and takes initiative
  • Humbly confident and takes pride in being a part of a true team


What’s in it for You:


  • Excellent earning potential
  • Hours Work/Life Balance
  • Comprehensive health benefits
  • Beautiful Work Environment

title: Shift Leader
description:
We’re hiring! Mastermind Toys - the Most Innovative Retailer of 2020 and Canada’s Authority on Play and we want YOU to join our growing team! We have a customer-obsessed culture, which we believe starts with employee experience. You’ll join an innovative, agile team of kids-at-heart—passionate about sparking wonder and new discoveries with everything we do. We jump at the chance to co-create with our customers and employees, while staying true to our Canadian roots. Over 36 years later, Mastermind Toys is the nation’s largest specialty toy and children’s bookstore, and we deeply believe that “Play is Kids’ Work.
We are currently seeking a Permanent Part-time Shift Leaderto join our Clarkson Crossing location. Our shift leaders bring fun, learning and confidence to parents & children by providing an exceptional customer experience and contributing to the profitability, success and growth of the store. They oversee store operations, including shift task organization and store opening and closing duties, in conjunction with/or in the absence of management.
This is a great growth opportunity for someone looking to expand their leadership skills in a part time role. We are seeking individuals with flexible availability including days, evenings, weekends and holidays.
Job and Responsibilities will include:
Sales Assistance and Processing

  • Greet, actively approach & assist customers consistent with the Mastermind customer experience philosophy; ensure customers are always the primary focus over tasks
  • Seek to understand customer needs, communicate relevant product information; be able to explain/demonstrate product use (demonstrate sound product knowledge across all product categories), age target, special features, options etc. & in-store promotions; make suggestions for additional product to enhance purchase. Inform customers of services and specials. Consistently deliver a shopping experience that is BETTER than expected
  • Receive & process payments, returns, exchanges accurately & in accordance with POS procedures and customer service and sales philosophy
  • Gift wrap purchase to standard
  • Actively contribute to achieve team and store goals

Store Operations

  • Participate to maintain best practice merchandising standards throughout the shift; create inviting, attractive displays; keep store shelves fully stocked and neat; assemble product as required
  • Participate in safeguarding staff, customers & product through pro-active assistance; comply with loss prevention and health and safety & emergency procedures
  • May be asked to participate in the health & safety committee and/or first aider programs. Ensure personal conduct is consistent with safety and security policies
  • Process inventory in and out of store in accordance with standardized procedures. May participate in inventory counts
  • Participate in general store upkeep including dusting, floor, carpet, window, kitchen and bathroom cleaning. Participate (as applicable) in external walkway maintenance
  • May participate in monitoring store supply levels
  • Complete other duties as may be assigned from time to time

Follow security systems and protocols. Participate and advocate the safeguarding of staff, customers & product through the management of pro-active assistance; zone management; compliance with loss prevention and health and safety; store maintenance & emergency procedures
Qualifications:

  • High school diploma preferred.
  • Previous retail sales and POS experience required
  • Previous experience in as a key holder or shift leader is preferred. Able to organize and get work done through others
  • Strong planning and accuracy skills
  • Demonstrated ability & interest to provide exceptional quality customer focused sales assistance
  • Able to project an enthusiastic, polite and welcoming demeanour. Strong & clear verbal and written communication skills

Mastermind Toys is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. Upon request, Mastermind Toys will, in consultation with the applicant, determine the nature of any accommodation that may be required.

title: HOUSEPERSON
description:
Create moments of joy that truly matter.

Exuding sleek sophistication and full of Zen-like energy, Shangri-La Vancouver is your urban sanctuary nestled between the mountains and the sea and located within the core of a vibrant metropolis. Occupying 15 floors of the tallest building in Vancouver, the hotel sits at the heart of the city’s most popular downtown areas. With a lustrous balance of tranquil surroundings coupled with inspirational design, Shangri-La Vancouver hosts people to the colourful joys of life. Shangri-La Vancouver has been awarded the Forbes Five-Star designation and the AAA Five Diamond honour; one of only four hotels in Canada to hold both acclaimed ratings.

Inspired by our Asian heritage, we obsess over the guest experience and seek to deliver hospitality from the heart. Our Colleagues are our unique strength. We seek to hire and develop charismatic, dedicated, and passionate individuals to make their dream career, a reality.

Join our world-class team as we pioneer new horizons.

Your Shangri-La awaits!

We are currently searching for a superstar Houseperson to join our Housekeeping Team. This is a Part Time position, earning a full wage of $26.50 per hour (following the completion of an initial 3 month probationary period).

Our ideal candidate would have an eye for detail and a personal standard of perfection, in providing a high cleaning standard that enhances our luxury guest experience. Areas of responsibility include public areas, back of house spaces, general housekeeping inventory and supporting our room attendants in preparing guest rooms. Our hardworking housekeeping professionals take great pride in ensuring our product shines, and exceed our guests expectations of cleanliness and comfort. The ideal candidate would bring previous experience in the industry from another hotel or resort, and fully understands quality standards of public area cleanliness and service excellence. Our award winning team of consummate hospitality professionals take pride in their work and warmly and genuinely engage our guests and fellow colleagues, keeping our workplace productive, professional and fun!

JOB REQUIREMENTS

With personal commitment and an emotional sense of gracious hospitality, make the most positive impact on guest experiences throughout all aspects of their stay by ensuring overall cleanliness, detail and care of hotel areas and guest rooms, maximizing the balance between Colleague, Guest and Owner satisfaction. Job responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Communicate with internal colleagues to advise and attend all the guest(s) service needs, items which require maintenance, issues or concerns in a prompt, proactive manner as appropriate
  • Clean and maintain public restrooms, public areas, back-of-house, and other assigned work areas within hotel and its surroundings using approved hotel products and equipment, to hotel housekeeping standard
  • Assist in the receiving of Housekeeping stock and prepare and maintain Housekeeping storage areas to Shangri-La standards of cleanliness and safety
  • Provide waste removal and janitorial duties specific to special cleaning projects, as assigned.
  • Removes trash collected by room attendants from service areas.
  • Deliver towels, toiletries, cribs, roll-away beds and other requested items to the guest rooms.
  • Pickup clean linens and refill the par stock of linen on each floor pantry, as required.
  • Cleans rugs, carpets and upholstered furniture using a vacuum cleaner, broom and shampoo machine.
  • Assist in the cleaning of guest rooms, including changing of sheets and removal of garbage
  • Collects soiled linen for laundering.
  • Assist in laundry area of hotel, as required.
  • Assist other Housekeeping Colleagues with the preparation of guest rooms, as assigned
  • Assist room attendants with moving heavy furniture items, as required
  • Complete deep cleaning tasks, as assigned such as sweeping, mopping floors and washing windows
  • Clean all public areas as required following department standard operating procedures.
  • Report missing / found articles, damage or merchandise problems to the housekeeping supervisors.
  • Report all defects and damage to Housekeeping Management to ensure it is logged and actioned
  • Undertake other ad hoc related responsibilities, as required.
Job Requirements/Qualifications:

The following is expected for this position:

  • Position is physical in nature and requires regular lifting, bending, reaching, stretching, squatting
  • Minimum 2 years previous work experience in a similar capacity is preferred
  • Demonstrated understanding of luxury hotel standards of service
  • Candidates must have unrestricted availability

SHANGRI-LA VANCOUVER COLLEAGUE PRIVILEGES

…we enable people to live, work, play, eat, and rest well through the environments we create and the memorable experiences we deliver! Our Colleagues have access to the following:

  • Adventure to 100+ Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts with Colleague Travel perks
  • Experience our renowned food & beverage with a special Colleague Discount
  • Pamper yourself with discounted wellness journeys and luxury products from CHI the Spa
  • Enjoy exclusive access to discounted theatre, cinema, and retailers through our partner programs!
  • Indulge in specialty pricing on luxurious pillowtop beds and linens through our partner programs.
  • Connect your event leads or employee referrals to earn special rewards.
  • Celebrate with your fellow Colleagues in team recognition events throughout the year.
  • Pursue your ongoing development through courses and learning workshops as part of the Shangri-La Academy
  • Pursue your own ongoing development through our education reimbursement program

ABOUT SHANGRI-LA HOTELS AND RESORTS

  • Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts has been established in luxury since 1971, with locations in North America, Asia, the Middle East, Europe, Oceania, and Africa.
  • Sister brands include Traders Hotels, Kerry Hotels, and JEN Hotels. Further, the Shangri-La Group holds a diverse portfolio of commercial properties, residences, services, and clubs.
  • CHI, The Spa at Shangri-La, draws inspiration from the origins of the Shangri-La legend, which describes a unique place of personal peace, enchantment, and well-being. This is a luxurious sanctuary where holistic treatments based on time-honoured methods shared by many Asian cultures bring total relaxation and a feeling of well-being.

Shangri-La Vancouver is committed to fostering a workplace that both promotes and places sincere value on diversity and inclusion. We are committed to maintaining a rich tapestry of talent from across race, gender, age, religion, identity, and life experience.

  • Salary/Wage: $26.50 + Shangri-La Colleague Perks
Job Application Process:

Interested candidates are encouraged to click the below link or visit our career portal at http://www.areyoushangri-la.com to apply directly for our positions. Due to the volume of applicants, we will only contact those candidates we wish to pursue further.

Shangri-La Vancouver will only consider candidates who currently possess the legal right to work in Canada. Applicants must be Canadian Citizens, Permanent Residents, or be in active possession of an Open Work Permit and valid Social Insurance Number. Shangri-La Vancouver is unable assist international applicants in obtaining the legal right to work.

We thank all applicants for their time and interest in Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts.

Working closely with the Property Manager to ensure tenant satisfaction, budgets and capital plans are prepared and managed as per objectives; negotiate, award and monitor building contracts in accordance with polices; preparation of property and monthly financial reports within the required timelines; liaise with tenants, contractors, and employees. The incumbent will assist the property manager to oversee the operational and administrative functions associated with the property, ensuring the asset is managed and operated at the highest possible standard in accordance with Brookfield’s goals, objectives and all applicable codes, environmental requirements, and government legislation.

Primary tenant contact for escalated inquiries and requests, requiring detailed coordination and communication between the tenants, operations, security, construction, accounting and building services ensuring all requests and concerns are dealt with in a professional manner to ensure tenant satisfaction.
Managing the day-to-day operations of the Tenant Services Department comprised of one Tenant Services Coordinator, one Building Services Supervisor, two Building Services Technicians and one Receptionist/Administrative assistant. Monitoring and providing daily support, participating in performance management, setting objectives, and providing development through training and education.
Take personal responsibility to promote and adhere to all safety, health, and environment policies. Lead by example to proactively identify, report, manage and mitigate potential hazards and follow through to resolution.
Liaising with base building contractors on projects ensuring they are completed as scheduled and in accordance with the budget guidelines including window cleaning, landscaping, waste removal, carpet cleaning, pest control, janitorial, parking, and common area repairs.
Assist in Supervising the $1.8 million Janitorial contract to ensure the contractor maintains compliance with the agreement, monthly costs are within the established budget and the service provided meets the tenants and Brookfield’s expectations. Conduct monthly meetings and inspections as required.
Attend Monthly Parking contract meetings and assist with parking recommendations to improve the parking experience, maximize revenue, and ensure parker satisfaction. Review monthly parking reports and ensure the data is cross referenced with Tenant lease information.
Conduct monthly “Key Account Meetings” with the large office tenants documenting discussions of their issues for distribution to all departments. Meet with other tenants including retailers on a regular basis and ensure all meetings are tracked and minutes are taken.
Coordinating all tenant move-in/move-out(s) in conjunction with construction, operations, security and building service/loading dock ensuring all procedures are followed. Ensuring signage, access cards, mailboxes, recycling, Life Safety manual and Tenant Information Guides are appropriately distributed. Conduct New Tenant Orientation meetings to ensure tenants are educated on the building regulations, procedures, and contacts.
Routinely review to ensure the Tenant Information Guide, Tenant Database and web site information is accurate and continuously update to date. Additionally, working with the Marketing team to ensure the Brookfield App updates accurate and timely.
Oversee the Tenant Services Coordinator and Financial Services Group, in monitoring that the Accounts Receivable process and ensure all outstanding balances are followed on a timely basis ensuring the A/R is always current.
Administration of all lease documentation, storage area management and leases ensuring the information is kept updated and accurate at all times.
Assisting the Property Manager to generate and compile the monthly financial report. Assist and provide support to the managers regarding variance comments and other requirements included in the monthly reports.
Assisting the Property Manager with budget preparation, contract negotiation and management of operating costs by adhering to purchasing processes, reviewing and approval of all billings, maintaining accurate maintenance and administrative records. Assist and provide support to the managers to ensure accurate and timely entry into YARDI relating to day-to-day expenses and one time projects.
Other duties as assigned.

SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS:
A proven leader, who exhibits and insists on a standard of excellence, and shares our vision to work collaboratively with others to meet our commitment to providing outstanding customer service. The ideal candidate works independently and has the proven ability to deal with difficult/sensitive situations. In addition, the successful candidate will have strong communication and organizational skills with the ability to multitask.

EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS:
Minimum 5 years working experience in a large commercial building environment.
Minimum 5 years management experience.
Minimum 5 years of experience with direct supervision of staff

EDUCATION / DESIGNATIONS / LICENSES:
University degree is an asset
Possess or working towards RPA, FMA or CPM.

We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are grateful for your interest in this position, however, only candidates selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

Assistant Merchant


Who We Are:

Elte is Toronto's source for considered design for all things home. For over 100 years, our family has worked with designers and craftspeople from idea to object, curating timeless pieces and the most distinct creations. Our sister brand, Mkt, is an independent design house creating pieces for a modern, edited home. We have three large showrooms within Toronto's Design District. In the Elte Showroom, you'll find Rugs and Carpeting, Furniture, Lighting, Mattresses, Linens and Home Decor.


Who you are:

You are a builder and entrepreneur who is savvy with numbers and have a strong retail acumen. You are passionate about product, obsessed with exceptional service, and deeply committed to bringing the best of design and taste to our customer. Under the leadership and guidance of the Director of Merchandising, you will work with Planners and Inventory Analysts as well as Product Leadership to shape the growth, financial success and strategy for your designated product category.


What You Do (among other things):

  • Work with cross-functional partners (Marketing, Digital, Store Sales, Product Development) for organization, presentation and approval of a go-to-market strategy and resulting product launch calendar
  • Create seasonal assortment buy sheets
  • Identify and input all product attribution and hierarchy designations
  • Organize price change recommendations and associated price change files
  • Develop and maintain a product knowledge resource library
  • Assist with training for new product launches and refreshers on existing product assortment
  • Attend cross-functional team huddles and department team meetings as a representative of the product category; keep and share diligent notes on deliverables and key takeaways from said sessions
  • Problem-solve issues and strategize solutions in coordination with other departments, including Purchasing, Sales, Marketing, Digital & Visual Merchandising
  • Partner with vendors to roll out packaging standards and maintain library of packaging files
  • Assist in the building of the product category’s core strategy, including SKU optimization, stock and replenishment approaches, vendor negotiations, competitive analysis, pricing ladders, etc.
  • Own a subset of the product category, under the guidance and leadership of the Director of Merchandising, to hone leadership skills and begin building autonomy through accountability for the success of decisions made
  • Be a steward for and advocate of the company’s Values
  • Embody service and serve as a positive representative the brand within the organization and outside of the company

Requirements & Desired Attributes:

  • 5 to 8 Years of applicable experience
  • Strong Excel skills
  • Experience in luxury and big-ticker retail environment strongly preferred
  • Passionate about product, design, and architecture
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and self-starter mentality
  • Strategic thinker with excellent attention to detail and ability to effectively communicate, inspire and achieve results
  • Curious, driven, and takes initiative
  • Humbly confident and takes pride in being a part of a true team


What’s in it for You:


· Excellent earning potential

· Hours & Work/Life Balance

· Comprehensive health benefits

· Beautiful Work Environment


If you are interested in this career opportunity, we'd love to hear from you! ELTE thanks all applicants who apply, but also those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
